      • refreshClusterView

        @Deprecated
public ClusterClientOptions.Builder refreshClusterView(boolean refreshClusterView)
        Deprecated. Use topologyRefreshOptions, see ClusterTopologyRefreshOptions.Builder.enablePeriodicRefresh(boolean)
        Enable regular cluster topology updates. The client starts updating the cluster topology in the intervals of refreshPeriod /refreshPeriodUnit. Defaults to false. See ClusterClientOptions.DEFAULT_REFRESH_CLUSTER_VIEW.
        Parameters:
        refreshClusterView - true enable regular cluster topology updates or false to disable auto-updating
        Returns:
        this

      • refreshPeriod

        @Deprecated
public ClusterClientOptions.Builder refreshPeriod(long refreshPeriod,
                                                              TimeUnit refreshPeriodUnit)
        Deprecated. Use topologyRefreshOptions, see ClusterTopologyRefreshOptions.Builder.refreshPeriod(long, TimeUnit)
        Set the refresh period. Defaults to 60 SECONDS. See ClusterClientOptions.DEFAULT_REFRESH_PERIOD and ClusterClientOptions.DEFAULT_REFRESH_PERIOD_UNIT.
        Parameters:
        refreshPeriod - period for triggering topology updates
        refreshPeriodUnit - unit for refreshPeriod
        Returns:
        this

      • closeStaleConnections

        @Deprecated
public ClusterClientOptions.Builder closeStaleConnections(boolean closeStaleConnections)
        Deprecated. Use topologyRefreshOptions, see ClusterTopologyRefreshOptions.Builder.closeStaleConnections(boolean)
        Flag, whether to close stale connections when refreshing the cluster topology. Defaults to true. Comes only into effect if ClusterClientOptions.isRefreshClusterView() is true. See ClusterClientOptions.DEFAULT_CLOSE_STALE_CONNECTIONS.
        Parameters:
        closeStaleConnections - true if stale connections are cleaned up after cluster topology updates
        Returns:
        this

        public ClusterClientOptions.Builder validateClusterNodeMembership(boolean validateClusterNodeMembership)

        Parameters:

      • maxRedirects

        public ClusterClientOptions.Builder maxRedirects(int maxRedirects)
        Number of maximal cluster redirects (-MOVED and -ASK) to follow in case a key was moved from one node to another node. Defaults to 5. See ClusterClientOptions.DEFAULT_MAX_REDIRECTS.
        Parameters:
        maxRedirects - the limit of maximal cluster redirects

      • requestQueueSize

        public ClusterClientOptions.Builder requestQueueSize(int requestQueueSize)
        Description copied from class: ClientOptions.Builder
        Set the per-connection request queue size. The command invocation will lead to a RedisException if the queue size is exceeded. Setting the requestQueueSize to a lower value will lead earlier to exceptions during overload or while the connection is in a disconnected state. A higher value means hitting the boundary will take longer to occur, but more requests will potentially be queued up and more heap space is used. Defaults to Integer.MAX_VALUE. See ClientOptions.DEFAULT_REQUEST_QUEUE_SIZE.
        Overrides:
        requestQueueSize in class ClientOptions.Builder
        Parameters:
        requestQueueSize - the queue size.
        Returns:
        this

      • disconnectedBehavior

        public ClusterClientOptions.Builder disconnectedBehavior(ClientOptions.DisconnectedBehavior disconnectedBehavior)
        Description copied from class: ClientOptions.Builder
        Sets the behavior for command invocation when connections are in a disconnected state. Defaults to true. See ClientOptions.DEFAULT_DISCONNECTED_BEHAVIOR.
        Overrides:
        disconnectedBehavior in class ClientOptions.Builder
        Parameters:
        disconnectedBehavior - must not be null.
        Returns:
        this
